comment: I go through fits of watching YouTube creators
Tonight seems to be CinemaSins. Nitpicking has never been so funny
I am going too. See ya.
I swear, I do not understand how LEague players can be so damned toxic.

Snowbaled a game off of a double kill counter gank top lane, went 18-2-3, and the damn top laner complains that he's going to report me for being a kill stealin whore because he totally could have taken the 2v1 alone.
Never been so tilted form a win before that I can't spell properly anymore.
ive given up on league years ago, precisely because of that, for me the few moments of fun are just outweighed by all the flaming and bitching

Tom, I want clarify one thing about my suggestion. Why did you not start painting royal dragon family? It's forbidden topic? Or I can suggest it at next time?

It's not something easy to do on the spot during a stream.
I would have to invent a dragon and a princess.
My first suggestion was "Historical moment. Reni's grandfather and human princess watching how first dragon princess hatching from an egg." but then I thought 3 new characters will be too much.
Perhaps next week when I'm not streaming sketches
And I'm not sure how exactly she was born. I mean dragons should be hatching from an egg. But her mother are human. Humans not lay eggs.
No stream at next week? Because of CCSD?
I like to think that Grandpa took Grandma and Tf-ed her into a Dragon.
...Or the other way around (like Euchre). That works too.
If a dragon turns into a human and get a child from a human I think born a human.
And If a dragon turns human into a dragon  and get a child from this dragon  I think born a dragon.
I think it will be logical.
To be fair, Dunkey got banned for being rather over the top toxic.
That gives me a bad idea. If it goes 'Grandma became a Dragon', the child could have courted a Keidran or a Basitin, turned them into a Dragon and made Reni.

Huh, got a letter from the Dept. of Labor.
Well at least it ain't from the IRS
They did an investigation into my last employer and found that I was owed some back wages.
A whopping $13.47 after they deducted taxes and Social Security.
Have to do some paperwork to collect it though.
Somewhere between my 2014-2017 employment, the missed an hour. Scary how thorough the govt. can be when they want.
a few months back i was applying for a us visa, sent in a photo of mine that was 8 months old
within 2 weeks i get an email that i need to send in an up to date photo of mine, because the one i sent in is over 6 months old
Yeah, most digital files have a lot of data tucked away that can be seen with special programs. I'd imagine the US government takes that stuff pretty seriously.
no meta data, it was a scan of a photograph
because i did not get a digital copy, because they wanted to charge 50€ for that
was just a temporary visa, work related, still official though
Did you use the same picture for anything else?
and that one is less than 6 months old
because i ordered it specifically for this journey
But if your passport photo was a digital file then it would contain the metadata too
na i only had to turn in a physical copy
I just got my passport recently, after having it go missing about a decade ago.
well, nice to have it back i guess?
I think I lost it on the plane during a return flight.

but apart from that... its basically new

so someone finally cleaned the plane and found the passport?
ah so its a new one!
